newsitem.title: BELGIUM: N.Atlantic trade eases in Jan-Nov 96 air cargo datA.
newsitem.headline: N.Atlantic trade eases in Jan-Nov 96 air cargo datA.

text.p: The Association of European Airlines (AEA) traffic update for January to November showed volume increases in most markets except the North Atlantic trade.
An AEA statement said only North Atlantic traffic saw a slight decline, when it fell 0.7 percent to 7,612.6m RTKF in January -November 1996, compared to the same period in 1995.

Geographical Europe rose slightly when it gained by 0.2 percent to 832.3m RTKF but the largest increases were seen in the Europe to North Africa and Middle East trade and the Europe to Far East and Australasia sectors.
The strongest growth was seen in the North Africa/Middle East trade, which rose by 16.4 percent to 931.1m RTFK. Europe to the Far East/ Australasia was up by 9.2 percent to 8,128.9m RTFK.
In total AEA's international traffic increased by 4.6 percent to 21,504.1m RTFK for the 11-month period, compared to 1995, the statement said.
*These figures relate to the international scheduled services of AEA member airlines.
Reuters Air Cargo Newsroom Tel+44-171-542-7706 Fax 5017
